page.title: 20 MORE LOCAL CUSTOMS
page.content: St Andrew's Day is celebrated by holding a Tartan Day each person must wear something Tartan that day a kilt or a tie or ribbon & we sing scots songs.Our favourite is Hey for the Tartan.We learned some singing games & rhymes in Scots & tried writing poetry & prose in Scots but most of us find it difficult.A Burns Supper is held in January & local people entertain by singing Burns songs,reciting poetry,highland dancing & playing the pipes.There are 3 young pipers in the area. Another local custom is still continued to this day.If you are walking under the Bow Briggie (the old train bridge) you are not allowed to speak or else bad luck will befall you.
